sections.heading: What is a Private Limited Company?
content: A Private Limited Company (Pvt Ltd) is the go-to choice for entrepreneurs, startups, and growing businesses in India, especially if you're planning to raise funds. It's governed by the Companies Act, 2013 and registered with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA).
Your company becomes a separate legal entity with limited liability and perpetual succession—perfect for building a business that's meant to last and grow.

Think of a Private Limited Company as a business entity where the business is divided into shares that represent ownership, and as a shareholder, you're only liable up to the amount you've invested in shares.

The company exists as its own legal person, separate from you and other owners. This means your company can own property, sign contracts, and even take legal action in its own name—completely independent of its owners.

sections.heading: Why Private Limited Companies Stand Out

points: It's a Separate Legal Entity: Your company has its own legal identity, distinct from you and the other directors or shareholders.
Your Personal Assets Stay Protected: With limited liability, you're only responsible for the amount you've invested in the company. Your personal assets remain safe.
The Business Outlives Its Founders: The company continues to exist even if ownership or management changes hands.
Perfect for Raising Capital: Venture capitalists, angel investors, and private equity firms prefer investing in Private Limited Companies.
Builds Trust and Credibility: Customers, suppliers, banks, and investors take you more seriously when you're a registered company.

Step 1: Get Your Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) — You'll need this to file electronic forms with the MCA.
Step 2: Obtain Director Identification Number (DIN) — This is a unique ID for each company director.
Step 3: Get Your Company Name Approved (SPICe+ Part A) — Choose a unique name for your company and get it approved by the MCA.
Step 4: File Your Incorporation Forms (SPICe+ Part B) — This includes Memorandum of Association (MOA), Articles of Association (AOA), PAN and TAN application for your company.
Step 5: Receive Your Certificate of Incorporation — The MCA will issue your certificate along with your CIN, PAN, and TAN.

points: Do I have to register as a Private Limited Company? — Yes, registration with the MCA is mandatory if you want to operate as a Pvt Ltd company.
Can I be the sole owner? — No, you need at least two shareholders. If you want to be the sole owner, consider registering as a One Person Company (OPC) instead.
Is GST registration mandatory? — Only if your turnover crosses the threshold limit or if your business activities require it.
Can foreigners be directors? — Yes, foreign nationals can be directors, but you must have at least one director who is a resident of India.
Can I convert my company to an LLP or Public Company later? — Yes, conversion is allowed under Indian law.
